DOC.brief_summary: The aim of the study was to compare the effectiveness of acute psychiatric day care to conventional inpatient care within a cross-national multi-site randomised controlled trial.
DOC.criteria: Patients must have presented with a mental disorder with current symptoms that had either led to at least a moderate disturbance in performance in more than one area of daily living or had jeopardized the residential, financial or occupational status of the patient or his family Treatments other than inpatient or day hospital care must have been inadequate or not sufficiently effective for the patientâ€™s current mental state Temporary admission for diagnostic purposes or for other reasons Under 18 or over 65 years Admission without consent of the patient (according to countryspecific legal regulations) Oneway journey to hospital longer than 60 minutes Suicidal risk Risk to others Degree of severity of the disorder requires measures restrictive of the patient's freedom on the day of admission, or a 1:1 supervision, or deems such probable Acute intoxication Main clinical diagnosis: addictive disorder Presence of a somatic disorder requiring inpatient care Direct transfer from a different hospital Homelessness Need for constant pickup and delivery service Inability to give informed consent with respect to participating in the study
